FuncDef:
The idle-timeout command sets an idle timeout period for the gRPC service.
The undo idle-timeout command restores the default configuration. The idle-timeout command sets an idle timeout period for the gRPC service. The undo idle-timeout command restores the default configuration. By default, the idle timeout period for the gRPC service is 10 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an idle timeout period for the gRPC service.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: If a collector functioning as a client initiates a connection to a device functioning as a server, the data sampled is dynamically subscribed to. In this case, you can run the idle-timeout command to configure an idle timeout period for the gRPC service. If no RPC connection is established before the idle timeout period expires, the gRPC service is disconnected and waits for the client to connect to the server again.
